ibis.ipl
Interface Ibis

All Superinterfaces:
Manageable
public interface Ibis
extends Manageable

The starting point of all Ibis communication, created using the IbisFactory.

The following Manageable items are recognized:

Manageable items
"outgoingMessageCount" the number of messages sent
"bytesWritten" the number of bytes sent in messages (multicasts are counted once)
"bytesSent" the total number of bytes sent
"incomingMessageCount" the number of messages received
"bytesReceived" the number of bytes received in messages
"bytesRead" the total number of bytes received

All these properties are long values, returned as a string.

Other items may be recognized, depending on the Ibis implementation.

Method Detail

end

void end()
         throws IOException
Returns all Ibis recources to the system. The Ibis instance also deregisters itself from the registry. As a result, other Ibis instances may receive a RegistryEventHandler.left(IbisIdentifier) upcall.

Throws:
IOException - is thrown when an error occurs.

registry

Registry registry()
Returns the Ibis Registry.

Returns:
the Ibis registry.

poll

void poll()
          throws IOException
Polls the network for new messages. A message upcall may be generated by the poll. There is one poll for the entire Ibis, as this can sometimes be implemented more efficiently than polling per port. Polling per port is provided in the receiveport itself.

Throws:
IOException - is thrown when a communication error occurs.

identifier

IbisIdentifier identifier()
Returns an Ibis identifier for this Ibis instance. An Ibis identifier identifies an Ibis instance in the network.

Returns:
the Ibis identifier of this Ibis instance.

getVersion

String getVersion()
Returns the current Ibis version.

Returns:
the ibis version.

properties

Properties properties()
Returns the properties as provided when instantiating Ibis.

Returns:
the properties.

createSendPort

SendPort createSendPort(PortType portType)
                        throws IOException
Creates an anonymous SendPort of the specified port type.

Parameters:
portType - the port type.
Returns:
the new sendport.
Throws:
IOException - is thrown when the port could not be created.

createSendPort

SendPort createSendPort(PortType portType,
                        String sendPortName)
                        throws IOException
Creates a named SendPort of the specified port type. The sendport name must be unique within this ibis instance.

Parameters:
portType - the port type.
sendPortName - the name of this sendport, or null, in which case the sendport is created anonymously.
Returns:
the new sendport.
Throws:
IOException - is thrown when the port could not be created.
IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when the port type does not match the capabilities that are required to create this sendport.

createSendPort

SendPort createSendPort(PortType portType,
                        String sendPortName,
                        SendPortDisconnectUpcall sendPortDisconnectUpcall,
                        Properties properties)
                        throws IOException
Creates a named SendPort of the specified port type. The sendport name must be unique within this ibis instance.

Parameters:
portType - the port type.
sendPortName - the name of this sendport, or null, in which case the sendport is created anonymously.
sendPortDisconnectUpcall - object implementing the SendPortDisconnectUpcall.lostConnection(SendPort, ReceivePortIdentifier, Throwable) method.
properties - the properties of the port.
Returns:
the new sendport.
Throws:
IOException - is thrown when the port could not be created.
IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when the port type does not match the capabilities that are required to create this sendport.

createReceivePort

ReceivePort createReceivePort(PortType portType,
                              String receivePortName)
                              throws IOException
Creates a named ReceivePort of the specified port type. with explicit receipt communication. The receiveport name must be unique within this ibis instance. New connections will not be accepted until ReceivePort.enableConnections() is invoked on this port. This is done to avoid connection upcalls during initialization.

Parameters:
portType - the port type.
receivePortName - the unique name of this receiveport (or null, in which case the port is created anonymously).
Returns:
the new receiveport.
Throws:
IOException - is thrown when the port could not be created.
IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when the port type does not match the capabilities that are required to create this receiveport.

createReceivePort

ReceivePort createReceivePort(PortType portType,
                              String receivePortName,
                              MessageUpcall messageUpcall)
                              throws IOException
Creates a named ReceivePort of the specified port type. with upcall-based communication. The receiveport name must be unique within this ibis instance. New connections will not be accepted until ReceivePort.enableConnections() is invoked. This is done to avoid connection upcalls during initialization. Upcalls will not be invoked until ReceivePort.enableMessageUpcalls() has been called. This is done to avoid message upcalls during initialization.

Parameters:
portType - the port type.
receivePortName - the unique name of this receiveport (or null, in which case the port is created anonymously).
messageUpcall - the upcall handler.
Returns:
the new receiveport.
Throws:
IOException - is thrown when the port could not be created.
IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when the port type does not match the capabilities that are required to create this receiveport.

createReceivePort

ReceivePort createReceivePort(PortType portType,
                              String receivePortName,
                              ReceivePortConnectUpcall receivePortConnectUpcall)
                              throws IOException
Creates a named ReceivePort of the specified port type. with explicit receipt communication. The receiveport name must be unique within this ibis instance. New connections will not be accepted until ReceivePort.enableConnections() is invoked. This is done to avoid connection upcalls during initialization. When a new connection request arrives, or when a connection is lost, a ConnectUpcall is performed.

Parameters:
portType - the port type.
receivePortName - the unique name of this receiveport (or null, in which case the port is created anonymously).
receivePortConnectUpcall - object implementing gotConnection() and lostConnection() upcalls.
Returns:
the new receiveport.
Throws:
IOException - is thrown when the port could not be created.
IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when the port type does not match the capabilities that are required to create this receiveport.

createReceivePort

ReceivePort createReceivePort(PortType portType,
                              String receivePortName,
                              MessageUpcall messageUpcall,
                              ReceivePortConnectUpcall receivePortConnectUpcall,
                              Properties properties)
                              throws IOException
Creates a named ReceivePort of the specified port type. with upcall-based communication. The receiveport name must be unique within this ibis instance. New connections will not be accepted until ReceivePort.enableConnections() is invoked. This is done to avoid connection upcalls during initialization. When a new connection request arrives, or when a connection is lost, a ConnectUpcall is performed. Upcalls will not be invoked until ReceivePort.enableMessageUpcalls() has been called. This is done to avoid message upcalls during initialization.

Parameters:
portType - the port type.
receivePortName - the unique name of this receiveport (or null, in which case the port is created anonymously).
messageUpcall - the upcall handler.
receivePortConnectUpcall - object implementing gotConnection() and lostConnection() upcalls.
properties - properties for the new receive port.
Returns:
the new receiveport.
Throws:
IOException - is thrown when the port could not be created.
IbisConfigurationException - is thrown when the port type does not match the capabilities that are required to create this receiveport.
